results.title: Impressionism
results.brief_description: Discusses the unique qualities of impressionism and shows examples of impressionistic master-pieces. The techniques are contrasted with the detailed photographic techniques of some former schools. Points of departure are in the selection of everyday subjects, the use of intense contrasts of light and shadow and bold generalised patterns using heavy applications of paint to give great action and movement.

results.title: Impression of Oakleigh Technical School. . a caring place
results.brief_description: An overview of Oakleigh Technical School as seen throught the eyes of Scott, one of the students. The school is show as having a vibrant school council with an innovative, stimulating program.

results.title: Impossible jump
results.brief_description: Can an Elephant jump? Watch it try as it avoids the deadly spears as it gathers the keys to get to the next level.

results.title: Importance of being frivolous
results.brief_description: A number of short amusing cartoons which show the advantages of an ordinary cheque account and the use of traveller’s cheques when overseas. Made for Barclay’s Bank, the cartoons have excellent commentaries.

results.title: Imperialism and European expansion
results.brief_description: The imperial expansion movement of 1875-1914. The industrial revolution and improved communication as causes; how nationalism, industrial rivalry, technological progress, the search for cheap raw materials and missionary activity affected it. Military, governmental and business movements into underdeveloped countries and the effect on the lives of subject peoples.

results.title: Imperial sunset: an inquiry into the nature of the Commonwealth
results.brief_description: An ironic history, culled from much archive film footage preserved in London, the former heart of Empire, and attested by several surviving servants of Empire whose pride and faith in past missions is not without dignity despite the questionable aspects of empire-building. Commenting on the course of Empire are members of the Establishment, and young people of former colonies.

results.title: Imperial city
results.creator_credit: Arbor Films, Margaret Williams and David Rowan
results.brief_description: In 1911, the British built a new capital for India. The creation of New Delhi was the greatest artistic enterprise of the British Empire, and we follow the architects in a search for a style incorporating British and Indian architecture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arbor Films, Margaret Williams and David Rowan

results.title: Impeachment
results.brief_description: “Summary: traces the history of impeachment from the Magna Carta through the American Revolution, the drafting of the U.S. constitution, the impeachment of Andrew Johnson and the issues involving Richard Nixon. explains the process of impeachment of a president and examines the roles of the House of Representatives and the Senate”

results.title: Impasse
results.brief_description: An experimental animated film, dedicated to Elfriede and Oskar Fischinger, which involves the use of Avery labels to produce graphic designs. No dialogue, musical soundtrack.
